docs.lead_paragraph: STUDENTS from two Westchester high schools headed back to school last month to do research on weather and pollen, hoping to forecast the duration and intensity of next year's allergy season. Supported by a $10,000 grant from Toyota, 14 students from Lakeland High School in Shrub Oak, which has a popular weather club, and nine students from Fox Lane High School in Bedford, where students have been recording pollen counts, spent five days at Fox Lane learning how to read weather maps, take pollen counts and do long-range forecasting.
docs.abstract: Article on research on weather and pollen, conducted by students from Lakeland High School in Shrub Oak, NY, and Fox Lane High School in Bedford, supported by $10,000 grant from Toyota, aimed at predicting duration and intensity of next year's allergy season; photo (M)

docs.lead_paragraph: Channing Frye spent some quality time sharing space with Dwight Howard on Thursday afternoon and emerged generally unscathed. It was an admittedly minor thing, but Frye is just hitting the first turn of his N.B.A. learning curve, and the Knicks will take encouragement in small feats. Howard was one of the N.B.A.'s top rookies last season, a 6-foot-11 dunking machine who made the leap from high school to the Orlando Magic look easy. Although Frye, 22, is three years older than Howard, he is an N.B.A. neophyte who does not have the same physical gifts.
docs.snippet: Channing Frye spent some quality time sharing space with Dwight Howard on Thursday afternoon and emerged generally unscathed....

docs.lead_paragraph: PASSIVE. He looked just too darn passive. Other times my son and I have flown together he was excited -- almost hyperactive. The engine noise at the start of the runway would get his own engines going. The first time he was on a plane with me Blake was about 3, and as we sped down the runway, he slapped my leg and said, in his Elmer Fudd voice, ''This is going to be fun!'' This time was different. Everyone else on the plane was terrified. It was a few weeks before the attacks in New York and Washington, so we didn't have anything that horrifying in our minds. We were flying out of Skopje, Macedonia, during a lull in the fighting there. Our plane felt as if it were slipping backward, the way it feels when a person tries to climb up a slide unsuccessfully.
docs.abstract: Dean Nelson travel essay on realization that his 14-year-old son, after accompanying him on trip, understood seriousness of situations in Tanzania, Kosovo and Macedonia; drawing (M)

docs.lead_paragraph: The good news in education is that attention is finally turning to the psychic and emotional qualities that children bring to the classroom.
docs.abstract: David Brooks Op-Ed column posits that shift away from considering emotional side of education has done grievous harm to education system in America; points to Paul Tough book Helping Children Succeed as positive sign of shift toward considering education through lens of emotional development.

docs.lead_paragraph: Massive open online courses are the educational happening of the moment. Everyone wants in. No one is quite sure what they’re getting into.
docs.abstract: Universities and organizations offering MOOCs, or massive open online courses, have been surprised by surge of enrollments and interest; format, new to many participants and instructors, presents both challenges and hope of bringing best in education to remotest corners of the world.
